definition: to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: The actors reproduced the running horses by pounding pillows.
sentences.chinese: 演员们捶打枕头模拟奔马的声音。

sentences.english: He shook his head and pointed to the two fingers he was hammering.
sentences.chinese: 他摇头并且指着他捶打着东西的两根手指。

sentences.english: Available massage methods by kneading finger press knocking.
sentences.chinese: 具有揉捏指压捶打等按摩方式。

sentences.english: The bark is stripped off, soaked, and beaten until it is thin.
sentences.chinese: 作法是剥取树皮后，经浸渍和捶打使它变薄。

sentences.english: Victoria followed, hammering furiously upon his door.
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚追将出来，狠命捶打房门。

sentences.english: I beat on the top of it with my fists.
sentences.chinese: 我用拳头捶打它的顶部。

sentences.english: Clench your fist lightly to beat the right haunch by two hands in turn.
sentences.chinese: 轻握拳头，双手交替捶打右臀部。

sentences.english: She heard a low hammering sound in the bed-room.
sentences.chinese: 她听见他的寝室里有一种低沉的捶打声音。

sentences.english: Bensley beat on the car before it sped away, Heyse said.
sentences.chinese: 在车开走之前，该男子批命捶打这辆车。

sentences.english: Agatha's mother beat the door of the vault wildly with her hands.
sentences.chinese: 阿佳莎的母亲拼命地用手捶打着地下室的门。

sentences.english: The child pummelled his mother angrily as she carried him home.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子因其母带他回家而生气地捶打着母亲。

sentences.english: Silvermiths hammer these ingots to the appropriate thickness by hand.
sentences.chinese: 银匠用手工把这些纯铁捶打到合适的厚度。

definition: to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
to pat/to slap/(of a bird) to flap (one's wings)
to knock/to grasp sth in the hand and beat it/to toughen oneself up
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
